title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: They were debtors to the subscribers for themonument, and on behalf of his fellow-residents heheartily thanked them. (Applause.) He then stated thatMr. Cameron, 77, Main Street, Gorbals, had in hispossession several cuttings, growing in a pot, taken byhimself and two other gentlemen from the bark of the oldtree which grew within a few yards of the present Memorial. The sprigs were cut from the trunk after it had lain on theground near the foundation for some time.
